parameters.toolDescription:
Gets all locations for a customer using customerID. Use this after identifying the customer account.
Information needed: customerID is required to look up locations.
Creates a new service location under an existing customer. Use this if location lookup fails or if the customer reports a new address.
Gets all customer contacts based on customer id and gives you contactmethodID
Search customers by address
Search customers by name
Looks up a customerâ€™s upcoming or in-progress appointments. Use this to check if a job is already scheduled before booking a new one.
Adds a new contact to a customerâ€™s account. Use when the customer provides a new name, email, or phone number to add to their profile.
Creates a new customer with name, contact info, and primary address. Use this when a brand-new customer calls in to schedule service.
Gets a list of jobs associated with a specific customer or location. Use to check if work is already scheduled or recently completed.
Creates an appointment for a job with the customerâ€™s preferred time and technician assignment.
Retrieves invoice records for a specific job or customer. Use to check if the work has been billed or paid.
Gets all memberships for a specific customer. Use this to check if a customer has an active or expired membership.

parameters.toolDescription: Gets all installed equipment for a specific location. Use this to verify model, serial number, and install date before quoting or booking service.
Assigns one or more technicians to an appointment. Use after an appointment is created to ensure dispatch is set.
Lists all published forms in ServiceTitan. Use this to match available forms for submission, like inspections or maintenance checklists.
Gets submitted forms tied to a job, customer, or location. Use this to verify form completion or pull inspection results.

parameters.toolDescription: Creates a new equipment record for a customer location. Use this after a unit is installed or reported by the customer.
Updates an existing customer's name, email, phone numbers, or mailing preferences. Use when the customer asks to change their profile information.
Updates a customer contactâ€™s name, phone, email, or notes. Use this when the customer provides updated contact info.
Updates a jobâ€™s summary, priority, or metadata using the job ID. Use this when the customer changes job details or follow-up notes are needed.
Deletes a specific appointment by ID. Use this if the customer wants to cancel a scheduled job or remove an appointment booked in error.
Deletes a contact from a customerâ€™s account using the contact ID. Use this when a contact is incorrect, duplicate, or requested to be removed.
Deletes a piece of installed equipment from a customerâ€™s location. Use if it was logged incorrectly or removed from service.
Gets all appointments tied to a specific job. Use this to check what has been scheduled or completed before booking or editing.
Reschedules an existing appointment by updating the technicianâ€™s start/end time and the customerâ€™s arrival window.
Searches pricebook services for quoting. Use this to pull flat-rate prices or item descriptions for estimates.
Retrieves internal tasks assigned to a user, customer, or job. Use this to follow up on escalations or check if the office has open tasks.
Updates a taskâ€™s status, notes, or assignment. Use this when marking a task complete or reassigning it to someone else.
Submits a completed form, such as an inspection or post-job survey, tied to a job, customer, or appointment.
Gets a list of active technicians. Use this to assign techs, look up IDs, or confirm availability.
Gets active business units (HVAC, plumbing, etc.). Use this when assigning a trade to a job or retrieving BU IDs.
Gets all active job types used to categorize service work. Use this to assign a job type when creating or updating a job.

parameters.toolDescription: Gets a list of active vendors for creating purchase orders. Use this to look up vendor IDs or filter by name.
Gets a list of active tags that can be applied to jobs, appointments, or customers. Use this to look up tag IDs by name.

Retrieves full invoice details by ID from ServiceTitan, including billing items, payments, job links, and status. This tool is essential for validating invoice data, reviewing billing accuracy, or displaying invoice history in a customer view.

Retrieves a list of customer payments from ServiceTitan, including payment amounts, methods, and associated invoices or jobs. Useful for reconciling revenue, generating financial reports, or validating payment statuses in real-time.

Uploads a file (e.g., PDF, image, document) as an attachment to a specified job in ServiceTitan. This tool is used to add technician forms, estimates, invoices, or supporting documents to a job record. File content must be base64-encoded or provided as multipart/form-data, depending on the API requirements.

Retrieves a paginated list of marketing campaigns from the ServiceTitan Marketing API. This tool allows filtering by campaign name, status, creation/modification date, and phone number. Useful for campaign reporting, validation, or automation workflows that depend on campaign metadata.
